author: 0xsadcat
content:
1 zkrollups only need to post state deltas, orus need to post everything, which means theoretically (as far as on-chain data goes) zkrollups allow for infinite tps.
2 they also allow maximum compression because decompression doesn't have to be possible on-chain at all - unlike orus
3 security is crypto based rather than fraud proof based, so nobody needs to watch for correctness. how many people *actually* are going to watch for fake state attempts on orus? major orus probably will have someone, but a small fork - not necessarily. a small fork of eg. zksync will still be safe

last but not least, zkrollups allow native anonymity/privacy, while orus don't. this is starting to go beyond evm. but it would be possible to have almost-compatible evm zkrollups in which all eoas are fully anon
